title: Tunic Yoke
content:
accession_no_csv: 2017-00593

  Image: 

  object_work_type: womenswear costume components

  title_text: Tunic Yoke

  preference: main

  title_language: English

  creation_date: 20th century

  creation_place_original_location: Multan District (Pakistan)

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: irregular

  materials_name: silk (textile) silver thread

  techniques_name: sewing (needleworking technique) embroidering

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: This is an embroidered yoke. It is red and yellow
 with silver embroidered geometric patterns. The yellow fabric with silver stitched pattern creates a semicircular collar a the top of the garment. There are no stains seen on the garment.

  subject_terms_1: geometric motifs tunics embroidery (visual works) folk costume

  subject_terms_2: Tunics Motifs Sindhi (South Asian people) Embroidery Ethnic costume Clothing and dress

  subject_terms_3: Indian costumes

  subject_terms_4: 

  sgcool_label_text: This is the front of a blouse
 or the yoke of a tunic
 that would be stitched onto a backing. It is a fine example of 20th century zardozi work
 as utilised on clothing in the Sindh region.
